title: The Smallest Rabbit in the World

content.en: Let me tell you about the smallest rabbit in the world. It can actually fit in the palms of your mom or dad's hands!
content.tw: 你知道全世界最小的兔子，比你爸爸媽媽的手掌還要小！

content.en: Scientists say the smallest rabbit in the world lives in just one part of America, and about 20 years ago, scientists thought they were all gone. Yeah! They thought the tiny rabbit was extinct... Like the dinosaurs! Gone, forever!
content.tw: 科學家說，美國只有一個地區有這種兔子，而且二十年前，他們就以為這種兔子像恐龍一樣絕種了！

content.en: But, they found 14 of these tiny rabbits, and they took them to a special zoo. The scientists worked very hard, and now these tiny rabbits are back in the wild. Cool, right?
content.tw: 後來他們找到14隻這種迷你兔，送到一個特別的動物園。現在這些兔子已經重返野外。

content.en: Some people see this super tiny rabbit and they want to get one, they think it would be a great pet. But actually, this cute little bunny is not a good pet. It is very small, so it gets scared very easily. To this rabbit, a human must look like a scary giant!
content.tw: 有一些人想要這種兔子當做寵物，但是牠們太小隻了，很容易被嚇到。對牠們來說，人類就像恐怖的巨人。

content.en: So, no. We shouldn't have them as pets, but we can be very happy that scientists found a way to save them.
content.tw: 所以，不。我們不應該把牠們當作寵物，但我們很高興科學家找到了拯救牠們的方法。

content.en: I hope these little bunnies have a happy life in the wild, and that we can see them on earth for a long, long time! Good luck, tiny rabbit!
content.tw: 我希望這些小兔子能在野外過著快樂的生活，並能長長久久地在地球上被看到！祝你好運，小兔子！

vocabulary.preface: 全世界最小的兔子並沒有絕種，不過需要保護。

content.text:
1. actually 實際上
How's the zoo? 動物園如何啊？
It's big and has lots of animals. 很大，有很多動物。
Are they cute? 動物可愛嗎？
Actually most of them are not.其實大部分都不可愛。

2. tiny 很小的
But I love those tiny rabbits. 但是我很喜歡那些小兔子。
They are even smaller than a mouse. 牠們甚至比老鼠還小。
It's just amazing! 滿驚人的。

3. pet 寵物
They could be good pets, too. 牠們也可以當好寵物。
No, I'm done keeping pets. 不了，我不養寵物了。

4. fit 適合
They don't fit my lifestyle. 牠們不適合我的生活方式。
You're right. Your house is too small. 說得對，你的房子太小了。

vocabulary.postscript:
今天的單字簡短好用。
actually 實際上
tiny 很小的
pet 寵物
fit 適合

C: They almost got much bigger

options: C: They get scared very easily

title: Satellite Finds New Group of Penguins

content.en: Today is World Wildlife Day. Let's talk about a wild animal that lives in a cold, icy place... the emperor penguin.
content.tw: 今天是世界野生動物日。我們來談談生活在冷冰冰地方的野生動物... 皇帝企鵝。

content.en: Emperor penguins live in Antarctica. It is their home, but it is too cold for people. How can we learn more about these wild animals?
content.tw: 皇帝企鵝生活在南極洲。這是他們的家，那裡對人類來說太冷了。我們要怎麼樣做才能更了解這些野生動物呢？

content.en: We can use a satellite. A satellite flies high in the sky. It can take photos of Earth.
content.tw: 我們可以使用衛星。衛星高飛在天空中，可以拍攝地球的照片。

content.en: Recently, scientists were looking at satellite photos of Antarctica, when they saw something strange. They saw a little dot on the ice. What was it?
content.tw: 科學家最近在查看南極洲的衛星照片時，看到一些奇怪的東西。他們在冰上看到一個小黑點，到底是什麼？

content.en: They looked closer, and saw the little dot was actually a big group of penguins. There were a thousand penguins in the group. They were living on the ice together, catching fish to feed their babies.
content.tw: 仔細看過之後，發現那個小點其實是一大群企鵝，大約有一千隻。他們一起生活在冰上，捕魚餵養企鵝寶寶。

content.en: The scientists are happy. There are fewer and fewer emperor penguins every year, so it's good news to find more.
content.tw: 科學家很高興。皇帝企鵝的數量一年比一年少，所以能找到更多是個好消息。

content.en: Now scientists can study this wildlife, all thanks to the satellite photos!
content.tw: 現在科學家可以研究這種野生動物，這都要感謝衛星照片！

vocabulary.preface: 靠著衛星照片，科學家更了解企鵝生態。

content.text:
1. mountain 山
The TV says it's snowing up on Hehuanshan! 電視說合歡山正在下雪！
Can we go up there now, please? 我們可以現在上去嗎，拜託？
Now? It's an icy mountain road! 現在？那可是結冰的山路！
I have to get ready. 我得要準備。

2. mean 意思
You mean we can't go up now? 你的意思是我們現在不能上山？
I mean we can't do that today. 我意思是我們今天沒辦法上山。

3. ice 冰
There's so much ice on the road! 馬路上好多地方結冰了。
I know. I told you it's not easy. 我知道。我就跟你說這不容易。

4. take photos 拍照
But it's so beautiful! 但是風景真好！
I want to take photos of this snow! 我要拍這些雪景！

vocabulary.postscript:

mountain 山
mean 意思
ice 冰

title: Girl Finds Huge Shark Tooth on Beach

content.en: The beach is a great place to relax. You can sit on the sand and enjoy the warm sun, or go for a swim in the sea.
content.tw: 海灘是放鬆的地方。你可以坐在沙灘上曬太陽，或者去海裡游泳。

content.en: You can also find cool things on the beach. There are animals like crabs and starfish. You can even find seashells. But what would you do if you found an ancient shark tooth?
content.tw: 海灘上還可以找到很酷的東西，比如說螃蟹，海星，還有貝殼。但如果你發現了一顆古老的鯊魚牙齒，你會怎麼辦？

content.en: That's what happened to a girl named Molly. She's nine years old, and her family has a special hobby. They like to look for shark teeth on the beach near their home in the USA.
content.tw: Molly 是一位九歲的美國女孩，她們家喜歡在家裡附近的海灘上找鯊魚牙齒。

content.en: On most days, Molly can find a few small teeth. She uses them to make necklaces. But recently, she found a very big tooth. It was special because it was more than three million years old.
content.tw: Molly 平常都能找到幾顆小牙齒，她會把它們做成項鍊。但最近，她找到了一顆超大的牙齒，超過三百萬年。

content.en: When Molly found the tooth, she was excited. Molly loves to study ancient animals, so she knew the tooth was from a Megalodon. A long time ago, that was the biggest shark in the world!
content.tw: Molly 很興奮，她喜歡研究古生物，所以她知道這是巨齒鯊的牙齒。以前，這個鯊魚是世界上最大的鯊魚！

content.en: There are no Megalodons alive today, so it is very unusual to find one of their teeth. That's why Molly was so happy, and why everyone was surprised by the tooth she found!
content.tw: 現在巨齒鯊已經絕種了，所以很難找到牠們的牙齒。這就是為什麼Molly這麼高興，以及為什麼每個人都對她找到的牙齒感到驚訝！

vocabulary.preface: 巨齒鯊曾經在地球上漫遊，從牠們留下的牙齒就知道。

content.text:
1. find 找到
Look, a shell! 你看，一枚貝殼！
This one is cool. 這個很酷呢！
You're lucky to find it. 你很幸運找到它。

2. tooth 牙齒
I'm actually hoping to find a fish tooth. 我其實希望找到魚的牙齒。
Fish tooth? 魚的牙齒？
Then it has to be a big fish. 那一定得是大魚。
Yeah, like a great white shark. 對，比如說大白鯊。

3. sea 海洋
I hope there are no sharks in the sea here. 我希望這個海域沒有鯊魚。
I don't think so, but you never know. 我想沒有，不過這很難說。

4. swim 游泳
So can we still swim here? 所以我們還能在這裡游泳嗎？
Why not? 為什麼不？
We're so skinny. 我們這麼瘦。

vocabulary.postscript:
你喜歡收集貝殼嗎？ Let's read the words.

find 找到
tooth 牙齒
sea 海洋
swim 游泳

content.en: India is a HUGE country. Many people there live in a state called Uttar Pradesh, and lots of those people are Hindu.
content.tw: 印度很大，有很多人住在一個叫做「北方邦」的地方，裡面不少人都是印度教徒。

content.en: Today is the start of an ancient Hindu celebration, called "Holi". It's a festival that's famous for having lots of color. People run around throwing paint at each other, it's really fun!
content.tw: 今天是印度教侯麗節開始的日子，這是一個色彩繽紛的節日，大家會到處在別人身上潑顏料！

content.en: Today, lots of Hindus use special eco-friendly paint, so they won't harm the planet.
content.tw: 現在很多人會用環保顏料，比較不會傷害地球。

content.en: The night before Holi people always light huge fires. They used to burn wood, which meant they had to cut down lots of trees, but that was really bad for the environment.
content.tw: 侯麗節的前一個晚上，大家還會升營火，人們以前會砍樹燒柴，但這樣對環境不好。

content.en: This year, in Uttar Pradesh, they're trying something new. They want to burn "cow wood" instead. What is cow wood? Don't worry, it isn't made out of cows! Actually, it's made from their poop!
content.tw: 今年，他們不燒木柴，改燒「牛柴」。你放心，牛柴不是用牛做的啦！它們其實是牛便便。

content.en: To make cow wood, farmers take some cow poop, shape it into a brick, and let it dry.
content.tw: 農夫會把牛便便收集起來，弄成磚塊的形狀，然後晾乾。

content.en: The Uttar Pradesh government wants to have 300 tons of cow wood ready for the huge fires… 300 tons?! That's as heavy as 3 blue whales! That's a lot of poop…
content.tw: 政府說，他們想要準備三百噸的牛柴來慶祝侯麗節，有三頭鯨魚這麼重！

content.en: This great idea is helping Hindus in Uttar Pradesh be good to the planet and enjoy their famous festival at the same time! Happy eco-friendly Holi, everybody!
content.tw: 這個好主意正在幫助北方邦的印度教徒善待地球，同時也能享受他們著名的節日！大家環保侯麗節快樂！

vocabulary.preface: 不再砍樹，改用牛柴，可以減少對環境的影響。

content.text: 1. celebration 慶祝 Oh no, is Saturday School Day? 糟糕，星期六是學校日嗎？ Yeah, why? 是啊，為什麼？ Don't you like celebrations? 你不喜歡慶祝嗎？ No, I just don't like the same thing every year.
2. color 顏色 I'm going to try something new this time. 這次我準備試一點新花樣。 Like what? 比如說什麼？ I'll prepare lots of color paper and cut it into small pieces.
3. throw 扔 And throw it at each other? 然後互相扔？ Yeah, we'll play a game first, and then throw it. 對，我們先玩遊戲，然後扔。 Sounds great ! Can I join your class? 聽起來真不錯。我可以加入你班上嗎？

vocabulary.postscript: 你喜歡參加慶典嗎？來讀讀單字。 celebration 慶祝 color 顏色 throw 扔

quiz.question: 1. What is Holi famous for?
2. What do people throw at each other during Holi?
3. What is 300 tons of cow poop as heavy as?

title: Space Commander Wants More Women in Science

content.en: Today is International Women's Day: a day for women and girls everywhere, from your mother, to your sister, to the President of Taiwan!
content.tw: 今天是世界婦女節，是給全世界女性的節日！

content.en: So we're going to look at one very special woman. Her name is Dr. Peggy Whitson, and she's an astronaut.
content.tw: 今天我們要聊聊 Peggy Whitson 博士，她是一位太空人。

content.en: Did you know only a quarter of all science jobs in the world are done by women right now? That's not very many...
content.tw: 目前全球在科學界工作的人，只有四分之一是女性。

content.en: There's a place up in space called the International Space Station. It always needs a "commander": a big boss in charge of keeping everyone safe.
content.tw: 太空中有個地方叫做國際太空站，這裡需要一位指揮官，確保大家的安全。

content.en: In 2007, Dr. Whitson became the International Space Station's first ever female commander!
content.tw: Whitson 博士在 2007 年成為了國際太空站的第一位女性指揮官！

content.en: So far, she's spent nearly 666 days in space. That's longer than any other woman ever!
content.tw: 她在太空中待了 666 天，是待在太空中最久的女性。

content.en: Dr. Whitson wants to help women and girls aim for the moon and reach for the stars! Now, thanks to her hard work, more girls might want to work in science, and maybe even fly to space!
content.tw: Whitson 博士想要幫助女性追求太空夢。也許現在會有更多女生也想要進入科學界工作，甚至上太空去！

content.en: Here's to Dr. Peggy Whitson. Happy International Women's Day, everyone!
content.tw: 向佩姬·惠特森博士致敬。祝大家國際婦女節快樂！

vocabulary.preface: 這位女博士不光是太空人，還是太空站的指揮官。

content.text:
1. science 科學。
People seem to believe that boys are better at natural science.
大家好像都認為男生比較擅長自然科學。
I don't think that's true. 我覺得不見得。

2. sister 姊妹。
Both of my sisters excel in math and science.
我的兩個妹妹數理科都很棒。
Do they plan to be scientists? 她們想當科學家嗎？

3. space 太空。
One of them wants to be an astronaut.
其中一個想當太空人。
Flying to space? 飛到太空嗎？
That's so cool! 很酷呢！

4. moon 月球。
Yeah, she'd like to visit the Moon someday.
對啊，她希望有一天去月球。
Will she invite us? 她會邀請我們嗎？
No, not you. 不會邀請你。
Me, perhaps. 也許會找我。

vocabulary.postscript:
我們來讀讀今天的單字。
science 科學
sister 姊妹
space 太空
moon 月球

quiz.question: 1. Who is International Women's Day for?
2. What did the International Space Station finally get in 2007?
3. So far, how long has Dr. Whitson spent in space?

title: Wildcat Poop Found on Mount Everest

content.en: Whoa! Is that a cat? It looks like a cat. It has a lot more fur, though… And it looks really angry! It looks like a grumpy old man!
content.tw: 這個動物長得好像貓，但是毛比較多，而且看起來在生氣，好像一個生氣的老頭子。

content.en: Maybe we would be grumpy too if we lived in the same places as these wildcats… These wildcats are called Pallas's cats. They live in dry, cold, and windy places. But guess what? We now know these cats also live on the tallest mountain in the world! Yep! Scientists found that Pallas's cats live on Mount Everest!
content.tw: 這種野貓叫做兔猻，牠們住在很乾燥寒冷、風很大的地方。而且科學家在世界最高峰--聖母峰上也發現牠們的蹤跡！

content.en: The scientists found that the cats live on a part of Mount Everest that's even higher than Taiwan's Jade Mountain! That's amazing! It's very, very cold on Mount Everest, but these cats have found a way to live there!
content.tw: 聖母峰比玉山還要高，上面超級寒冷，但是這些野貓卻有辦法活下去！

content.en: Pallas's cats are about the same size as a pet cat, but they look more like leopards. They are very good hunters. Their fur is thick to keep them warm, and it's the perfect color to help them hide in the rocky, snowy mountains.
content.tw: 兔猻跟家貓差不多一樣大，但是長得比較像獵豹。牠們很會打獵，還有厚厚的毛可以保暖。毛的顏色也讓他們可以在山上躲起來。

content.en: Wildcats are some of my favorite animals! Now that I know they can live on the tallest mountain in the world, I like them even more! Where does your favorite animal live?
content.tw: 野貓是我最喜歡的動物之一！現在我知道牠們能住在世界上最高的山上，我更喜歡牠們了！你最喜歡的動物住在哪裡呢？

vocabulary.preface: 這種厲害的野貓可以在世界最寒冷的地方存活。

content.text:
1. look like 看起來像
Oh boy, that cat looks like a grumpy old man.
天哪，那隻貓看起來像個壞脾氣的老頭。
It's a stray cat. 那是一隻流浪貓。
It lives a hard life. 牠的生活很不容易呢。

2. windy 多風的
Yeah? It doesn't need to work. 是嗎？牠又不需要工作。
No, but it lives on a cold and windy street.
是不需要，但是牠住在又冷又風大的街上。

3. warm 溫暖的
You feed it every night. 你每天晚上都餵牠。
Not every night.沒有每晚。
And you also try to keep it warm. 而且你還想辦法讓牠保持溫暖。

4. maybe 也許
What can I say? 我能說什麼？
I just love animals. 我就是喜歡動物。
Maybe you should take it home. 也許你應該把牠帶回家。

vocabulary.postscript:
這些單字每天都用得到。
look like 看起來像
windy 多風的
warm 溫暖的
maybe 也許

quiz.question: 1. What are these wildcats called?
2. Where did scientists find the cats living?
options: A: At the bottom of the ocean

quiz.question: 3. Why do these cats need such thick fur?

content.en: Today I'd like to tell you all about someone very special. She's called Dinkie Flowers. Dinkie lives in a sleepy town in the south of England. All her life, Dinkie has loved to dance. She started dancing when she was just 3 years old, and hasn't stopped!
content.tw: Dinkie Flowers 住在英國南方一個純樸的村莊，她很喜歡跳舞，從3歲就開始，到現在仍然樂此不疲。

content.en: When she grew up, she became a professional dancer. As long as Dinkie was dancing, she was happy.
content.tw: 她後來成為職業舞者。她跳舞的時候很快樂！

content.en: She even opened her own school. She teaches people all her best dance moves! She calls it "The Dinkie Flowers Stage School".
content.tw: 她甚至創辦了自己的學校來教跳舞，叫做 Dinkie Flowers 表演學校。

content.en: A few years ago, Dinkie was on TV! She was in a competition called "The Greatest Dancer".
content.tw: 幾年前，Dinkie 參加了一個叫做「最偉大的舞者」的電視比賽。

content.en: Incredibly, Dinkie is 101 years old! She's one of the oldest people in the UK! When she was on TV, she was 98!
content.tw: 不可思議地，Dinkie 上電視的時候，她是 98 歲，今年已經101歲了！她是英國人瑞的其中一位。

content.en: Her friends and family all say she still looks super young! What's her secret?! She says it's because she loves dancing so much!
content.tw: 她說她長壽的祕密就是愛跳舞。

content.en: Her favorite dance is ballet. She practices every day. She believes that as long as you keep on moving, you can live forever! Keep on dancing, Dinkie!
content.tw: 她最喜歡的舞蹈是芭蕾。她每天練習。她相信只要持續運動，就能永遠活下去！Dinkie，繼續跳舞吧！

vocabulary.preface: 很多人都說健康長壽的祕訣是多活動，Dinkie證明了這一點。

content.text: 1. best 最好的 A dance teacher came to our school today. 今天有一位跳舞老師來我們學校。 What did she do? 她做了什麼呢？ It's he. 他是男生。 He's one of the best hip hop dancers in Taiwan. 他是台灣最棒的嘻哈舞者。
2. move 動作 Wow ! So he showed you his dance moves? 所以他表演舞步給你們看？ Yeah, and the kids loved him so much! 對啊，孩子們超喜歡他！
3. keep on 持續 They kept on dancing and moving. 他們一直蹦蹦跳跳。 I wish he could come back and teach us more. 我希望他能再回來教我們更多。
4. become 變成 And you'll all become cool hip hop dancers! 這樣你們都會變成很酷的舞群！ We may stage a show someday! 我們有一天還會登台演出呢！

vocabulary.postscript: So what words have you learned today? best 最好的 move 動作 keep on 持續 become 變成

quiz.question: 1. Where in the south of England does Dinkie Flowers live?
2. What is Dinkie Flowers' school called?
options: a. The Dinkie Flowers Music School
b. The Dinkie Flowers Dance School
c. The Dinkie Flowers Stage School

title: Too Much Screen Time Is Bad for You

content.en: This is my favorite show! I can watch it on my TV, my computer, my phone, my tablet… *gasp* The battery's run out!
content.tw: 我可以用電視、電腦、手機，或是我的平板電腦??電池沒電，我就不能看我最愛的節目了！

content.en: Okay, I need to calm down. I know, I know. It's only a TV show. It's not a big deal.
content.tw: 好吧，我需要冷靜下來。我知道，我知道。這只是一個電視節目。沒什麼大不了的。

content.en: I have very bad self-control with electronic devices. I spend too much time on them. Do you too? It's really hard to put them down!
content.tw: 我花太多時間在電子產品上，但就是忍不住。

content.en: I need to try harder though. Did you know that spending too much time on electronic devices isn't very good for your brain? It's especially bad if you're a kid.
content.tw: 你知道用太多電子產品對大腦不好嗎？對兒童的腦袋來說特別不好。

content.en: Some scientists did some research. It showed that when little kids spend too much time staring at screens, it is bad for their brains.
content.tw: 一些科學家做了一些研究。研究顯示，當小孩子花太多時間盯著螢幕時，這對他們的大腦有害。

content.en: The kids that used devices too much had a hard time. They couldn't stay focused, remember things, follow instructions, or control themselves well.
content.tw: 科學家發現，看太多螢光幕的小孩很難專心、很健忘、不聽指示，也不太會控制自己。

content.en: They were also less alert. That means they weren't very good at noticing things around them.
content.tw: 他們對周圍環境也沒有甚麼警覺心。

content.en: Well, that isn't good! I like using all of my devices. But staring at screens too long is bad for my brain. I should probably think of other things to do.
content.tw: 嗯，這不好！我喜歡使用我的所有設備。但是盯著螢幕太久對我的大腦不好。我應該想想其他事情來做。

content.en: Hm… maybe I should go outside or read a book instead!
content.tw: 嗯...也許我應該出去外面走走，或者讀一本書來代替！

vocabulary.preface: 科學家的研究證明，盯著電腦或是手機太久，對腦子不好！

content.text: stare at 盯著 You've been staring at your cellphone for a long time. 你盯著手機好久了。
watch 注意看 Maybe you should watch it on TV. 也許在電視上看比較好。 My TV is not connected to the internet. 我的電視不能上網。
spend 花費 I think I've spent 10 hours on it. 我想我花了十個鐘頭看這個節目。 Your brain must be fried. 你的腦袋一定累壞了。
brain 腦袋 Yeah, and it becomes harder to put the phone down. 對啊，而且越來越難放下手機。 I understand. 我懂。 For a fried brain, we have to have fried chicken. 壞掉的腦袋一定要吃炸雞！ Good idea! 好主意！

vocabulary.postscript: What words have you learned? stare at 盯著 watch 注意看 spend 花費 brain 腦袋

title: Government Pays Families to Leave Tokyo

content.en: Do you live in a big city? If you do, you know it is crowded.
content.tw: 你住在大城市嗎？如果是，你應該知道它很擁擠。

content.en: More families are moving, and leaving the country for the city all the time. They come from the countryside and from small towns.
content.tw: 越來越多家庭移動前往城市， 他們來自鄉下跟小鎮。

content.en: These families are looking for good jobs and good schools. They hope to find these opportunities in big cities.
content.tw: 這些家庭希望有更多機會找到好工作跟好學校。

content.en: What's the biggest city in the world? It's Tokyo, Japan.
content.tw: 世界上最大的城市在哪裡？在日本東京。

content.en: Tokyo, in Japan, has almost 40 million people.
content.tw: 東京擁有近 4000 萬人口。

content.en: This is a problem for Japan. Nobody wants to live in the countryside. But Tokyo is too crowded.
content.tw: 沒有人想留在鄉下，但是東京太擁擠了，這已經成為日本的難題。

content.en: Now the Japanese government is paying families to leave Tokyo. Each family will be given one million yen for every child when they move to the countryside.
content.tw: 現在日本政府要付錢讓更多家庭離開東京。他們會給每個家庭每個孩子一百萬日元讓他們搬走，相當於22萬台幣。

content.en: Families take that money and move to the countryside. The money is nice, but families understand the countryside has good things too.
content.tw: 領到錢的家庭會搬到鄉下，當然除了金錢之外，他們也明白鄉村地區的優點。

content.en: There is more space to live. Plus, children can be closer to their families who never left the countryside. Now, more and more families take the money and leave Tokyo. Would you?
content.tw: 有更多的居住空間。此外，孩子們可以更親近那些從未離開鄉下的家人。現在，越來越多的家庭拿了錢離開東京。你會這麼做嗎？

vocabulary.preface: 日本政府為了紓解大都市的人口壓力，付錢讓人搬回鄉下。

content.text:
1. leave for 前往
I'm leaving for Japan next week. 我下星期去日本。
Where in Japan? 日本哪裡？
Gifu, a little place in the countryside. 岐阜，在鄉下的一個小地方。

2. crowded 擁擠的
Taipei is too crowded for you? 台北對你來說太擠了？
Yes, I need space and Gifu has some cute small towns.
對，我需要空間，岐阜有一些可愛的小鎮。

3. town 鎮
We have many cute small towns here. 這裡也有可愛小鎮啊。
There's no such thing here. 這裡沒有那種東西。
Yes, there is! 有啊！

4. understand 了解
I understand you're trying to keep me here. 我明白你想讓我留在這裡。
But I won't stay. Not for a million NT. 但是就算給我一百萬我也不會留在這裡。

vocabulary.postscript:
來一起讀單字。
leave for 前往
crowded 擁擠的
town 鎮
